availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Franklin Ingham (Louisville, Kentucky, stone sawyer)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, stone sawyer. West Virginia native. Son of Jamison Ingham and Delia Ingham. Married to Victoria Green Ingham in Hardin County, Kentucky, on June 29, 1864. Father of Maggie Green. Resident of Wood County, Virginia, in 1850. Stone sawyer in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Wood County, District 65, p. 110B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 10, p. 261B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Hardin County Marriages, Film 007718289.
"James Franklin Ingram," Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 13477.
